firstNightReminder: Wake the Teacher. Show them the character token marked with the "Seen" reminder. Put the Teacher to sleep.
name: Teacher
ability: You start knowing the nearest “Once per game” character (not the Demon) or that none are in play.

firstNightReminder: Show the Huntress the nearest Minion character, then point to your left or your right to indicate which direction it's closer in.
name: Huntress
ability: You start knowing the nearest Minion character & whether it’s clockwise or anticlockwise from you.

firstNightReminder: The Prankster points to a player. Put them to sleep. If it's a Minion, mark that player with "Pranked", then wake that Minion and show them the "This character affected you" card and the Prankster token. All "Pranked" Minions choose a player; mark that player with "Demon Learns Tonight." Finally, wake the Demon, and point to each player marked "Demon learns tonight" in turn, and show them the corresponding character.
otherNightReminder: The Prankster points to a player. Put them to sleep. If it's a Minion, mark that player with "Pranked", then wake that Minion and show them the "This character affected you" card and the Prankster token. All "Pranked" Minions choose a player; mark that player with "Demon Learns Tonight." Finally, wake the Demon, and point to each player marked "Demon learns tonight" in turn, and show them the corresponding character.
name: Prankster
ability: Each night, choose a player: if a Minion, their ability becomes "Each night, choose a player: the Demon learns their character."

name: Beachcomber
ability: Each day, visit the Storyteller to learn 1 fact no other on-script Townsfolk could learn with their ability.

jinxes.reason: The Beachcomber can learn information the Amnesiac can learn. If the Amnesiac is in play, the Beachcomber can not learn what they can with their current ability.
The Beachcomber can learn information the Scrounger can learn.

name: Grandmaster
ability: Once per game, during the day, visit the Storyteller to learn your most important ally, but not why they’re important.

name: Scrounger
ability: Once per game, during the day, visit the Storyteller & choose a player: learn a true statement. If they’re evil, it’s false instead.

firstNightReminder: You may wake the Occultist and indicate any form of information you wish; mark them with "Learned info" afterwards. They will not wake again.
otherNightReminder: You may wake the Occultist and indicate any form of information you wish; mark them with "Learned info" afterwards: They will not wake again.
name: Occultist
ability: You might be executed unless you are “mad” about having learned something new every day. Once per game, at night, you learn something.

firstNightReminder: Pretend to the Wind-Viced they have the Minion ability they think they have. If it is in play, it is an Au'Wre game; do not run Minion info.
otherNightReminder: Pretend to the Wind-Viced they have the Minion ability they think they have.
name: Wind-Viced
ability: You think you are a Minion, but you are not. [The Demon is Au’Wre]

firstNightReminder: Show the Huli Jing 5 out-of-play characters: mark each with "Seen". Then, they pick one: mark it with "Has ability of & might register as". Until dusk, run that ability as if the Huli Jing was that character, and you may register the Huli Jing as that character or alignment.
otherNightReminder: The Huli Jing points to a character on their character sheet: mark it with "Has ability of & might register as". Until dusk, run that ability as if the Huli Jing was that character, and you may register the Huli Jing as that character or alignment.
reminders: Has ability of & might register as
name: Huli Jing
ability: You start knowing 5 out-of-play characters. Each night, choose 1 of them: until dusk, gain its’ ability & you might register as it would.

firstNightReminder: The Miasma shakes their head no or nods their head yes. If they said yes, mark the Grimoire with the "Townsfolk are poisoned + false info" reminder and the Miasma with the "No ability" reminder, then do not wake the Miasma again.
otherNightReminder: The Miasma shakes their head no or nods their head yes. If they said yes, mark the Grimoire with the "Townsfolk are poisoned + false info" reminder and the Miasma with the "No ability" reminder, then do not wake the Miasma again.
name: Miasma
ability: Once per game, at night, choose that all Townsfolk are poisoned & their abilities yield false info until dusk.

firstNightReminder: Skip the Minion info step, and do not show the Au'Wre their Minions during the Demon info step. This ability applies even if the Au'Wre is somehow drunk or poisoned.
otherNightReminder: The Au'Wre points to a number of players equal to their in-play Minions (if they don't know how many that is, signal it). For each, nod yes or no to indicate if they are a Minion, and mark them with "Guessed". If all Minions are marked with "Guessed", mark the Au'Wre with "Found", and announce that Good must kill evil today or win at dawn.
name: Au'wre
ability: Each night*, guess your Minions: learn which are correct. If all are, good learns this, and must kill evil today or lose. [Evil don’t learn each other]

jinxes.reason: The first time Au’Wre guesses the Magician, they learn the Magician is a Minion.
